tokens.definition: Λαοδίκεια Laodíkeia, lah-od-ik'-i-ah; from a compound of G2992 and G1349 ; Laodicia, a place in Asia Minor:—Laodicea.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Laodicea (6x).
outline: Laodicea = "justice of the people" a city of Phrygia, situated on the river Lycus not far from Colosse. It was destroyed by an earthquake in 66 A.D. and rebuilt by Marcus Aurelius. It was the seat of the Christian church.

In John, denotes the essential Word of God, Jesus Christ, the personal wisdom and power in union with God, his minister in creation and government of the universe, the cause of all the world's life both physical and ethical, which for the procurement of man's salvation put on human nature in the person of Jesus the Messiah, the second person in the Godhead, and shone forth conspicuously from His words and deeds. Note: A Greek philosopher named Heraclitus first used the term Logos around 600 B.C. to designate the divine reason or plan which coordinates a changing universe. Cambridge Dictionary of Philosophy (2nd ed) : Heraclitus, 1999.

outline: a valuing by which the price is fixed of the price itself of the price paid or received for a person or thing bought or sold
of the price itself
of the price paid or received for a person or thing bought or sold
honour which belongs or is shown to one of the honour which one has by reason of rank and state of office which he holds deference, reverence
of the honour which one has by reason of rank and state of office which he holds
deference, reverence

tokens.definition: πρός prós, pros ; a strengthened form of G4253 ; a preposition of direction; forward to , i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of , i.e. pertaining to ; with the dative case, by the side of , i.e. near to ; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):—about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, ([where-]) by, for, × at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), + together, to ([you]) -ward, unto, with (-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards , accession to , or nearness at .
tokens.kjv_translation_count: unto (340x), to (203x), with (43x), for (25x), against (24x), among (20x), at (11x), not translated (6x), miscellaneous (53x), variations of 'to' (1x).
outline: to the advantage of
at, near, by
to, towards, with, with regard to

tokens.definition: πλησμονή plēsmonḗ, place-mon-ay'; from a presumed derivative of G4130 ; a filling up, i.e. (figuratively) gratification:—satisfying.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: satisfying (1x).
outline: repletion, satiety, for the satisfying of the flesh, to satiate the desires of the flesh indulgence of the flesh
indulgence of the flesh

tokens.definition: ὁ ho, ho; the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom):—the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: which (413x), who (79x), the things (11x), the son (8x), miscellaneous (32x).
